present.spanish: Voy al trabajo en metro todas las mañanas.
present.english: I go to work by subway every morning.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Vas a la universidad en bicicleta.
present.english: You go to university by bicycle.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Vas al gimnasio después del trabajo.
present.english: You go to the gym after work.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Va a la oficina muy temprano cada día.
present.english: He/She goes to the office very early every day.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Vamos de compras los fines de semana.
present.english: We go shopping on weekends.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Vais al cine todos los viernes por la noche.
present.english: You all go to the movies every Friday night.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Van al parque con los niños cada tarde.
present.english: They go to the park with the children every afternoon.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Fui a París el año pasado por trabajo.
preterite.english: I went to Paris last year for work.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Fuiste al concierto de rock anoche.
preterite.english: You went to the rock concert last night.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Fuiste a la fiesta de cumpleaños de María.
preterite.english: You went to María's birthday party.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Fue al médico por el dolor de espalda.
preterite.english: He/She went to the doctor for back pain.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Fuimos a la playa durante las vacaciones.
preterite.english: We went to the beach during vacation.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Fuisteis al museo de arte moderno ayer.
preterite.english: You all went to the modern art museum yesterday.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Fueron al restaurante nuevo del centro.
preterite.english: They went to the new restaurant downtown.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Iré a estudiar a Alemania el próximo año.
future.english: I will go to study in Germany next year.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Irás a la entrevista de trabajo mañana.
future.english: You will go to the job interview tomorrow.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Irás a conocer lugares increíbles en tu viaje.

future.english: He/She will go to the international conference in May.

present.spanish: Hablo español con mis compañeros de trabajo.
present.english: I speak Spanish with my coworkers.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Hablas muy bien inglés para ser principiante.
present.english: You speak English very well for a beginner.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Hablás como un verdadero porteño.
present.english: You speak like a true Buenos Aires native.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Habla por teléfono con su madre todos los días.
present.english: He/She talks on the phone with his/her mother every day.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Hablamos de nuestros planes para el futuro.
present.english: We talk about our plans for the future.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Habláis demasiado rápido para los estudiantes.
present.english: You all speak too fast for the students.

present.spanish: Hablan en voz baja durante la película.
present.english: They speak in low voices during the movie.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Como frutas y verduras todos los días.
present.english: I eat fruits and vegetables every day.

present.spanish: Comes muy saludable desde que empezaste la dieta.

present.spanish: Comés las mejores milanesas de la ciudad.
present.english: You eat the best milanesas in the city.

present.spanish: Come en el restaurante italiano cada viernes.
present.english: He/She eats at the Italian restaurant every Friday.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Comemos juntos en familia los domingos.
present.english: We eat together as a family on Sundays.

present.spanish: Coméis tapas en el bar de la esquina.
present.english: You all eat tapas at the corner bar.

present.spanish: Comen pizza los viernes por la noche.
present.english: They eat pizza on Friday nights.

present.spanish: Vivo en el centro de la ciudad desde hace años.
present.english: I live in the city center for years now.

present.spanish: Vives cerca del parque y es muy conveniente.

present.english: You live in the most beautiful neighborhood in Buenos Aires.

present.spanish: Vive con sus padres para ahorrar dinero.
present.english: He/She lives with his/her parents to save money.

present.spanish: Vivís en el mismo barrio desde la infancia.

present.spanish: Viven en el mismo edificio que nosotros.
present.english: They live in the same building as us.

present.english: I can help you with the project if you want.

present.spanish: Puedes hacerlo mejor si te concentras más.

present.spanish: Podés venir a casa cuando quieras.

present.spanish: Puede hablar tres idiomas con fluidez.

present.spanish: Podemos terminar el trabajo antes del viernes.

present.spanish: Pueden resolver el problema sin ayuda externa.
present.english: They can solve the problem without external help.
